review: I know many people have brand loyalty, but I am one that does not. That being said, I am impressed with the speed and usability of the new Amazon Fire TV. I cannot believe how seemless it operates, how small it is for what it does, and the sheer number of apps and even GAMES that it supports and plays! You can even hook up a bluetooth controller that is NOT made by Amazon, and it works wonderfully. This product is a must, especially if you are an Amazon Prime member. Wonderful buy, puts the Roku, Apple TV and Chromecast to shame. Wonderful!!!!!UPDATEI was blown away by the thing at first, but now its borderline unusable. Will not get my wifi signal without unplugging it and plugging it back in, then disconnecting the remembered wifi channel, and reconnecting. And even after all that, it still takes over a minute to connect.The UI is always very laggy, and does not respond to button pushes on the remote until 10-15 seconds later, making searches frustrating and painful. The box also does not have a switch or option to TURN IT OFF. Such a simple thing, why isn't it able to do even that? The more time goes by, the more I wish I could return this thing, but its out of date with amazon.
author: SGT Walter Fulmer

review: I've seen the competition at other peoples' houses, so I never thought that I'd ever stream TV/Movies. But when I finally joined Amazon Prime, it was a no-brainer to buy Fire TV. As a former software engineer of graphical user interfaces, this is by far the most impressive thing I've seen. It's fast and really easy to use. Ten-second skip forward or backward is a nice -- in a noisy house where you missed the dialog. Throw in speech-search capability and TONS of prime content to watch and Amazon's done it again. Nice job Amazon, great piece of hardware and great piece of software too!
